solution_line_template: If Isabella has ${isabella_more_than_giselle} more than Giselle, she has ${giselle_money}+${isabella_more_than_giselle} = ${isabella_money}
Isabella has ${isabella_more_than_sam} more than Sam, meaning Sam has ${isabella_money}-${isabella_more_than_sam}=${sam_money}
Together, Sam, Isabella, and Giselle has ${isabella_giselle_combined}+${sam_money}=$<<{isabella_giselle_combined}+{sam_money}={total_money}>>{total_money}

if they donate the money to {num_shoppers} shoppers at their local town's supermarket who then decides to share it equally, each shopper will receive ${total_money}/{num_shoppers}=$<<{total_money}/{num_shoppers}={money_per_shopper}>>{money_per_shopper}
